metadata.description: Complete poultry value chain terminology - from breeding to processing
metadata.source: Extracted from University of Kentucky Poultry Glossary, Hy-Line guides, industry standards

air_cell.description: The air space between the two shell membranes, usually at the large end of the egg

candling.description: Using a light source (candler) to examine the contents of an egg to assess fertility and embryo development

setter.description: Incubation equipment where eggs are placed for the first 18 days of incubation

hatcher.description: Equipment where eggs are transferred on day 18 for final incubation and hatching

hatchability.description: The percentage of fertile eggs that successfully hatch when incubated

pip.description: When a chick breaks through the shell prior to hatching

embryology.description: The study of the formation and development of embryos

germinal_disc.description: The site of fertilization in an egg where embryo development begins

chick_quality.fr: qualité poussin, qualité du poussin d'un jour
chick_quality.description: Assessment of newly hatched chicks using scoring systems like Pasgar or Tona method

egg_storage.fr: stockage des œufs, conservation des œufs à couver
egg_storage.description: Holding fertile eggs at controlled temperature and humidity before incubation

turning.description: Periodic rotation of eggs during incubation to prevent embryo adhesion

forced_air_incubator.fr: incubateur à air pulsé, couveuse ventilée
forced_air_incubator.description: Incubation equipment with a fan to circulate warm air uniformly

fumigation.description: Sanitation process using formaldehyde or hydrogen peroxide to disinfect eggs and equipment

breakout_analysis.description: Post-hatch examination of unhatched eggs to diagnose fertility and embryo mortality issues

embryonic_mortality.description: Death of embryos during incubation, classified as early (1-7 days), mid (8-14 days), or late (15-21 days)

stunning.en: stunning, electrical stunning, controlled atmosphere stunning
stunning.fr: étourdissement, étourdissement électrique, étourdissement atmosphère contrôlée
stunning.description: Process of rendering birds unconscious before slaughter using electrical current or gas

scalding.description: Hot water treatment to loosen feathers before plucking

evisceration.description: Removal of internal organs during processing

carcass_yield.description: Percentage of live weight remaining after slaughter and processing

ultimate_ph.description: Final pH of meat measured 24 hours post-mortem, indicator of meat quality (target: 5.7-5.9)

drip_loss.fr: perte par exsudation, perte de jus
drip_loss.description: Loss of moisture from meat during storage, indicator of water holding capacity

breast_yield.description: Weight of breast meat as percentage of carcass weight (modern broilers: 25-28%)

woody_breast.fr: syndrome du muscle blanc strié, poitrine dure
woody_breast.description: Meat quality defect characterized by abnormally hard breast meat texture

white_striping.description: Visible white striations parallel to muscle fibers in breast meat, quality defect

pse_meat.description: Meat quality defect: pale color, soft texture, high drip loss (pH < 5.7)

dfd_meat.description: Meat quality defect: dark color, firm texture, dry surface (pH > 6.2)

giblets.description: Edible internal organs: heart, gizzard, and liver

chilling.description: Rapid cooling of carcasses post-processing (air chilling or water chilling)

deboning.description: Removal of bones from meat cuts

haccp.en: HACCP, Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points
haccp.fr: HACCP, Analyse des dangers et points critiques
haccp.description: Food safety management system identifying and controlling hazards in processing

point_of_lay.fr: entrée en ponte, âge à la ponte
point_of_lay.description: Age when pullets begin laying eggs (typically 16-20 weeks)

hen_day_production.description: Eggs produced per hen per day, expressed as percentage (peak: 95-98%)

hen_housed_production.description: Total eggs divided by number of hens placed, accounting for mortality

haugh_unit.description: Measure of egg freshness based on albumen height and egg weight (target: >72 for AA grade)

shell_strength.fr: résistance de la coquille, force de rupture
shell_strength.description: Force required to break eggshell, measured in Newtons (target: >35-40 N)

shell_thickness.description: Thickness of eggshell measured in micrometers (target: 330-350 µm)

yolk_color.fr: couleur du jaune, score fan Roche
yolk_color.description: Intensity of yolk pigmentation measured on Roche color fan scale (1-15, target varies by market)

laying_persistency.description: Ability of hens to maintain egg production over time without significant decline

peak_production.description: Maximum egg production rate achieved by a flock (typically 95-98% at 24-28 weeks)

molt.description: Natural or induced period when hens stop laying and renew feathers

induced_molt.description: Deliberate triggering of molt to extend productive life of laying hens

blood_spot.fr: tache de sang, tache de viande
blood_spot.description: Small blood or tissue inclusion in egg, causing downgrading

dirty_eggs.description: Eggs with fecal matter or debris on shell, requiring cleaning or downgrading

cracked_eggs.description: Eggs with shell cracks, unsuitable for sale as shell eggs

egg_weight.fr: poids de l'œuf, poids moyen des œufs
egg_weight.description: Mass of individual egg (target varies by age: 50-65g depending on strain and week)

heritability.description: Proportion of phenotypic variance due to genetic factors (0.0-1.0 scale)

breeding_value.en: breeding value, estimated breeding value, EBV
breeding_value.description: Genetic merit of an individual for a trait, estimated from performance data

selection_intensity.fr: intensité de sélection, pression de sélection
selection_intensity.description: Proportion of individuals selected as parents for next generation

genetic_gain.description: Improvement in trait performance per generation due to selection

inbreeding.description: Mating of related individuals, increasing homozygosity (should be <1% per generation)

crossbreeding.description: Mating individuals from different genetic lines or breeds

heterosis.description: Superior performance of crossbred offspring compared to purebred parents

selection_index.description: Weighted combination of multiple traits for simultaneous selection

generation_interval.description: Average age of parents when their offspring are born (shorter = faster genetic progress)

genomic_selection.fr: sélection génomique, sélection assistée par marqueurs
genomic_selection.description: Selection using DNA markers to predict breeding values

snp.description: Single base-pair variation in DNA sequence used as genetic marker

pedigree.description: Record of an individual's ancestry and genetic relationships

progeny_test.description: Evaluation of breeding value based on performance of offspring

genetic_correlation.description: Relationship between genetic values of two different traits (-1.0 to +1.0)

phenotype.description: Observable characteristics of an individual (genetic + environmental effects)

starter_feed.description: High-protein feed for chicks 0-10 days (22-24% crude protein)

grower_feed.description: Intermediate protein feed for growing birds 11-24 days (20-22% CP)

finisher_feed.description: Lower protein feed for final growth phase 25+ days (18-20% CP)

metabolizable_energy.description: Energy available to bird after accounting for fecal and urinary losses (kcal/kg)

crude_protein.description: Total nitrogen content of feed multiplied by 6.25, expressed as percentage

lysine.description: Essential amino acid, first limiting in poultry diets (requirement: 1.0-1.3% of diet)

methionine.description: Essential sulfur-containing amino acid (requirement: 0.45-0.55% of diet)

calcium.description: Essential mineral for bone development and eggshell formation (requirement: 0.9-4.0% depending on type)

phosphorus.description: Essential mineral for bone formation (requirement: 0.4-0.6% available P)

feed_conversion_ratio.description: Kg feed required per kg body weight gain (modern broilers: 1.4-1.7)

pellets.description: Feed compressed into bite-sized cylindrical pieces

crumbles.description: Pellets broken into smaller pieces suitable for young chicks

phytase.description: Enzyme added to feed to release phosphorus from phytic acid

coccidiostat.description: Feed additive to prevent coccidiosis infection

coccidiosis.description: Parasitic disease caused by Eimeria protozoa affecting intestinal tract

newcastle_disease.description: Highly contagious viral disease affecting respiratory, nervous, and digestive systems

avian_influenza.description: Viral disease with high and low pathogenic strains (HPAI, LPAI)

marek_disease.description: Viral disease causing tumors and immunosuppression in chickens

gumboro_disease.en: Gumboro disease, infectious bursal disease, IBD
gumboro_disease.description: Viral disease affecting bursa of Fabricius, causing immunosuppression

ascites.description: Accumulation of fluid in abdominal cavity, often in fast-growing broilers

necrotic_enteritis.description: Bacterial disease caused by Clostridium perfringens affecting intestines

colibacillosis.description: Bacterial disease caused by pathogenic Escherichia coli strains

biosecurity.description: Set of preventive measures to reduce disease introduction and spread

vaccination.description: Administration of vaccines to stimulate immune response against diseases

mortality.description: Percentage of birds that die during a production cycle (target: <5% broilers, <8% layers)

culling.description: Removal of unproductive or diseased birds from flock

necropsy.description: Examination of dead bird to determine cause of death

stocking_density.description: Number of birds per square meter (typical: 10-15 birds/m² for broilers)

ventilation_rate.description: Volume of fresh air provided per bird per unit time (m³/hour/bird)

tunnel_ventilation.description: Longitudinal airflow system for cooling in hot weather

evaporative_cooling.description: Cooling system using water evaporation to reduce air temperature

nipple_drinker.description: Automated watering system with individual drinking points

bell_drinker.description: Open circular water container suspended above floor

chain_feeder.description: Automated feeding system with chain-driven feed distribution

litter.description: Absorbent floor material (wood shavings, rice hulls, straw)

ammonia_level.description: Concentration of ammonia gas in poultry house (target: <25 ppm)

light_intensity.description: Amount of light measured in lux (requirement varies: 5-60 lux depending on age/type)

photoperiod.description: Hours of light per 24-hour period (affects growth and laying)

heat_stress.description: Physiological stress when birds cannot dissipate excess body heat (>30°C)

cold_stress.description: Stress from inadequate temperature for age (<18°C for young chicks)

brooding_temperature.description: Temperature for newly hatched chicks (32-35°C first week, decreasing weekly)
